criteria: Modeling Situations and Translation Between Forms
descriptions: No understanding of arithmetic sequences is demonstrated.
Struggles to identify arithmetic sequences and their components (common difference, first term).
Identifies arithmetic sequences but has difficulty applying the concept or formulating expressions.
Understands arithmetic sequences and can apply the concept, but with some errors in calculations or formulations.
Demonstrates a solid understanding of arithmetic sequences. Can formulate expressions and solve problems with minor errors.
Demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of arithmetic sequences. Can accurately formulate expressions, solve problems, and explain the concepts clearly.
No understanding of geometric sequences is demonstrated.
Struggles to identify geometric sequences and their components (common ratio, first term).
Identifies geometric sequences but has difficulty applying the concept or formulating expressions.
Understands geometric sequences and can apply the concept, but with some errors in calculations or formulations.
Demonstrates a solid understanding of geometric sequences. Can formulate expressions and solve problems with minor errors.
Demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of geometric sequences. Can accurately formulate expressions, solve problems, and explain the concepts clearly.
Cannot construct recursive formulas for arithmetic or geometric sequences.
Struggles to construct recursive formulas, even with guidance.
Can construct recursive formulas with significant errors or omissions.
Constructs recursive formulas with some errors or requires prompting.
Constructs mostly accurate recursive formulas for both arithmetic and geometric sequences.
Constructs accurate and complete recursive formulas for both arithmetic and geometric sequences, demonstrating a clear understanding of the process.
Cannot construct explicit formulas for arithmetic or geometric sequences.
Struggles to construct explicit formulas, even with guidance.
Can construct explicit formulas with significant errors or omissions.
Constructs explicit formulas with some errors or requires prompting.
Constructs mostly accurate explicit formulas for both arithmetic and geometric sequences.
Constructs accurate and complete explicit formulas for both arithmetic and geometric sequences, demonstrating a clear understanding of the process.
Unable to model situations with sequences or translate between recursive and explicit forms.
Struggles to model situations and translate between forms, even with considerable guidance.
Attempts to model situations and translate between forms, but with limited success and significant errors.
Can model simple situations and translate between forms with some errors or omissions.
Models situations and translates between recursive and explicit forms with reasonable accuracy.
Accurately models complex situations and translates fluently between recursive and explicit forms, demonstrating a deep understanding of the relationship between the two.
